title: SimplifiedPrivacy
author: SimplifiedPrivacy
content: SimplifiedPrivacy.comWe’re so passionate about open source software and privacy, that we setup an entire business around it.  We have a team of technical support staff to help you with any of the following:Linux Tech Support:Linux Installs, Dual Partitions, Fixing broken package managersArch Installs or Breaking from updatesVirtual Machine setups or advice, KVM VirtManager or Oracle Kicksecure & Whonix Configurations for Privacy and SpeedSetup or Fix “Self-hosted” Services on a VPS:Email: Mail-in-a-Box or iRedMailNextcloud cloud storageTor Node Entrances (avoid government ones)PeerTube (avoid Youtube censorship)XMPP Servers w/ OMEMOSelf-hosted Matrix Server (protect metadata)Self-hosted Jitsi video conferenceMonero node or miningRouters:pfSense Setups for VPN (you pick provider)OpenWRT for TorDD-WRT for VPN (you pick provider)Hosting Websites/Blogs Anonymously:Web 3 Website Setups on IPFSAnonymous WordPress Art DesignsNo JavaScript Web Development (Payments, captchas)(we’re not doing darknet markets, legal work only)Setup Tor Onion Service for your Clearnet SiteAdvice on DNS/Host providers to avoid censorshipAnonymous Social Media accounts (get passed 2FA or Tor blocks)Twitter or Reddit Promotion Upvotes (contact us for pricing packages)Video animation or voice-overs for your productSoftware Questions or Fixes:Using Emulation for Android on Linux desktopVeraCryptFile Deletion using BleachBitCryptocurrency Questions (Ethereum, Solana, Arweave, IFPS)Learn PGP Encryption with KleopatraPhysical DeGoogled GrapheneOS phones mailed to you, or remotely help you flash your own PixelContact us:SimplifiedPrivacy.comSession ID: SimpleSignal #: +855 68 504 905XMPP@SimplifiedPrivacy.is@Matrix:SimplifiedPrivacy.isemail:Support@SimplifiedPrivacy.comWe do NOT do custodial crypto mixing or darknet markets.  Nothing illegal, this is just technical support or marketing.  Please enjoy our free educational content on our website SimplifiedPrivacy.com.

comments.author: worldofcoins
comments.body: I went through parts of your site, and it is still going on.I've found "GrapheneOS Pixel 6a - Like New - $300" Phone. I've used the iPhone since 2015 and haven't faced any issues.If in the future I decide to change my brand of the phone, then I'll go with your Pixel 6a or an even better phone by the time you have it.Thank you for taking the time to write on the forum.
